qas.question: What is a perk of the central bank?

answers.text: it can make as much money as it deems needed

qas.question: What kinds of assets does the US Federal Reserve buy?

answers.text: bonds issued by the Federal government

qas.question: What kind of asset will the Federal Reserve purchase in mass quantities at a time of crisis?
What is the purpose of buying commercial paper in a time of financial crisis?

answers.text: to ensure that adequate liquidity is available for functioning

plausible_answers.text: it can make as much money as it deems needed

qas.question: What is a disadvantage of the central bank?

plausible_answers.text: bonds issued by the Federal government

qas.question: What kinds of assets does the US Federal Reserve ban?
What kind of asset will the Federal Reserve sell in small quantities at a time of crisis?

plausible_answers.text: to ensure that adequate liquidity is available for functioning

qas.question: What is the purpose of selling commercial paper in a time of financial crisis?

context: In central banking, the privileged status of the central bank is that <a0_0><b4_0>it can make as much money as it deems needed<b4_0/><a0_0/>. In the United States Federal Reserve Bank, the Federal Reserve buys assets: typically, <a1_0><b5_0>bonds issued by the Federal government<b5_0/><a1_0/>. There is no limit on the bonds that it can buy and one of the tools at its disposal in a financial crisis is to take such extraordinary measures as the purchase of large amounts of assets such as <a2_0><b6_0>commercial paper<b6_0/><a2_0/>. The purpose of such operations is <a3_0><b7_0>to ensure that adequate liquidity is available for functioning<b7_0/><a3_0/> of the financial system.
